column4: can someone tell me why my computer keeps freezing all the time?
I'd really appreciate some explanation or how to diagnose this, because I'm sick of it
about to go on an anti ubuntu campaign and never use it again, it's ridiculous
I visit a web page, whole computer freezes
since when does a userspace process run away and take down teh whole system in linux?
Just calm down..
A system freeze is almost always a problem with a kernel driver module.. most commonly, graphics or wifi
Can you pastebin the output of 'lspci && lsusb && lsmod'?
to pastebin.com
and yes, you should run memtest overnight and see if it reports any errors
Because they're actually three separate programs
I know that, thanks.
Then why did you ask..
Have you tried unplugging all usb devices except keyboard and mouse?
That wont work right in a unity session
he said he's in classic.
no, why would I do that?  I don't have any usb devices besides keyboard and mouse
You're not paying attention
So your fingerprint reader is built-in?
yes
What about Texas Instruments, Inc. eZ430 Development Tool ?
And it's built -in?
Then get lost
You can leave
